intro: Ottleya rigida, commonly known as the rigid ottleya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, rigid stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Ottleya rigida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
